children.value: Client-side utility for browser-based WebGL render tests.
This class is intended to be used with
. Together they support the following workflow:
Launch a Puppeteer instance (headless or non-headless) to run a test application
In the test application, create a canvas and
For each test case, render something to the
, take a screenshot, and perform pixel-diffing with a pre-defined "golden image". Report the matching result.
Proceed to the next test case until done.
// This is the script that runs in Node.js and starts the browser
// Bundles and serves the browser script
In your script that is run on the browser:
// `onRender` receives animation props from the AnimationLoop
Add one or a list of test cases. Each test case may contain the following fields:
(String) - path to the golden image, relative to the root where the node script is executed.
(Number) - time to wait for this test case to resolve (by calling the
callback) before aborting, in milliseconds. If not provided, fallback to the shared option that is passed to
(Object) - image diffing options for this test case. See "Image Diff Options" section below.
(Function) - called once when the test case starts. Receives a single object that is the
. If this callback returns an object or a promise, the content that it resolves to will be passed to
(Function) - called every animation frame when the test case is running. Receives a single object that is the
(Function) - must be called when the test case is done rendering and ready for screen capture and comparison.
(Function) - called once when the test case is done to finalize all resources. Receives a single object that is the
(Number) - time to wait for each test case to resolve (by calling the
callback) before aborting, in milliseconds. Default
(Object) - image diffing options for all test cases. This will be overridden if a test case defines its own
(Function) - callback when a test starts. Receives the current test case. Default logs the test name to console.
(Function) - callback when a test passes. Receives the current test case and the diffing result. Default logs the pixel matching percentage to console.

(Function) - callback when a test fails, either because the matching rate is below threshold or a critical error. Receives the current test case. Default logs the error message or the pixel matching percentage to console.
that resolves when all test cases are done.

Whether the test is being run in headless mode. In headless mode, Chromium uses software render which behaves slightly differently from non-headless. Image diffing tolerance may need to be adjusted accordingly.
The test renderer and each test case may choose to override the default image diffing options. The following options from
